title: Week Pulse — Dallas Surges, Berlin Survives, Pressure Mounts in Saint Catherine
summary: Momentum builds in Dallas, Berlin keeps escaping late drama, and Saint Catherine faces its toughest stretch yet.
body: Dallas is no longer just winning — they are dictating games. The offense is moving with confidence, the defense is closing drives, and for the first time this season, they look like a complete team rather than a collection of moments.

Berlin continues to walk the tightrope. Another late-game survival keeps them in contention, but the pattern is concerning. Close finishes build character, but they also expose cracks. How long can they rely on last-minute resilience?
Meanwhile, Saint Catherine’s season is slipping. Expectations were high, and early promise suggested a breakout year. Instead, inconsistency and late-game collapses are defining their narrative.
This week could reshape the league. Momentum is real, pressure is rising, and the standings are beginning to reflect identity rather than randomness.

title: Power Rankings Shake-Up — A New Top Three Emerges
summary: A surprise result forces a reshuffle at the top as contenders separate themselves from pretenders.
body: The top of the WFL has officially shifted. After weeks of debate and narrow margins, a surprise result forced voters to reconsider the pecking order.
Dallas climbs on consistency alone. They are not flashy, but they are efficient. In a league defined by chaos, stability has become a weapon.
Madrid remains dangerous despite recent turbulence. Their ceiling might still be the highest in the league, but the floor has dropped enough to invite criticism.
Berlin holds strong in the rankings despite close calls. Critics argue their record flatters them, but wins are wins — and the standings rarely care about aesthetics.
The debate continues in Fan Activity. Agree or disagree, the league has never felt tighter.

title: Fraud Watch Goes Live — Who Is Getting Too Much Hype?
summary: The most controversial poll of the season is now open — fans decide who’s overrated.
body: Every season has one team that rides the wave of perception longer than production. The question is simple: who is that team this year?
Fraud Watch is not about disrespect — it is about accountability. Records matter, but context matters more. Are certain teams benefiting from reputation rather than performance?
The vote is live now in Fan Activity. One click, no accounts, and your voice shapes the conversation.
Results will be featured in the next WFL Pulse. Choose carefully — narratives can shift overnight.
